data.title: Sao Tome and Principe
data.meta_description: Comprehensive destination guide to Sao Tome and Principe with tips and advice on things to see and do, ways to save money and help to plan your trip.
data.text:
São Tomé and Príncipe, an African island nation close to the equator, is part of a volcano chain featuring striking rock and coral formations, rainforests and beaches. Discovered and claimed by Portugal in the late 15th century, the islands' sugar-based economy gave way to coffee and cocoa in the 19th century.

It has a rather chequered history of the slave trade and slave labour, of colony and colonisers, of revolutionaries and freedom movements, of military coups and elections. Visitors to the islands swear by its cocoa, by its virgin beaches and crystal clear waters, steamy jungles and extinct volcanoes, by its Creole culture and Afro-Latin music – reasons enough to visit the islands.

The best time to visit São Tomé and Príncipe is during the dry season, which runs from June to September. During this period, the weather is generally sunny with lower humidity and less rainfall, making it ideal for outdoor activities such as hiking and exploring the beaches.

It's worth noting that even during the dry season, there can still be occasional rainfall, and temperatures can vary depending on the location and altitude.

The rainy season in São Tomé and Príncipe typically runs from October to May, with the highest rainfall occurring between March and May. While this period can be challenging for some activities due to the heavy rains, it is also a great time to see the lush green landscapes, vibrant flora and fauna, and waterfalls.

Ultimately, the best time to visit São Tomé and Príncipe depends on your personal preferences and interests. If you're looking for sunny weather and outdoor activities, the dry season is the best time to visit. But if you want to experience the stunning natural beauty and unique culture of the islands, the rainy season can also be a great time to go.

São Tomé and Príncipe offers visitors a unique blend of natural beauty, history, and culture. Here are some of the best things to see and do when visiting this beautiful country:

Explore the natural beauty: São Tomé and Príncipe is known for its lush rainforests, beautiful beaches, and volcanic peaks. Take a hike through the Obo National Park, visit the stunning Praia das Conchas beach, or climb the Pico Cão Grande rock formation for incredible views.

Discover the local culture: São Tomé and Príncipe has a rich cultural heritage, influenced by Portuguese and African traditions. Visit the historic colonial architecture of the capital city of São Tomé, explore the Roça Agostinho Neto plantation to learn about the history of slavery on the island, or attend a traditional dance or music performance.

Sample the local cuisine: São Tomé and Príncipe has a unique culinary tradition that combines African and Portuguese flavors. Try local dishes such as fish stew, grilled lobster, and cassava bread, or visit a local market to sample fresh fruits and vegetables.

Snorkel or dive in the clear waters: The waters around São Tomé and Príncipe are home to beautiful coral reefs and a diverse array of marine life. Take a snorkeling or diving excursion to see colorful fish, sea turtles, and even whale sharks.

Relax on the beautiful beaches: São Tomé and Príncipe has some of the most beautiful beaches in the world. Spend a day lounging on the white sand of Praia Banana or Praia Piscina, or take a boat tour to discover hidden coves and secluded beaches.

Visit the smaller islands: Ilhéu das Rolas and Lagoa Azul are two small islets off the coast of São Tomé Island that offer unique experiences. Visit the equator line on Ilhéu das Rolas or snorkel in the crystal-clear waters of Lagoa Azul.

Go birdwatching: São Tomé and Príncipe is home to a number of unique bird species, many of which are found nowhere else in the world. Take a birdwatching tour to see the São Tomé kingfisher, Príncipe seedeater, and other rare birds.

Overall, São Tomé and Príncipe offers visitors a wealth of natural beauty, cultural experiences, and outdoor activities. Whether you're looking to relax on the beach or explore the island's history and culture, there is something for everyone in this beautiful country.

São Tomé and Príncipe is known for its unique cuisine, which blends African and Portuguese flavors. Here are some dishes you should try when visiting the country:

Calulu: A stew made with fish or chicken, tomatoes, onions, okra, and spices, served with rice.

Cuscuz: A savory cake made with cornmeal and vegetables, often served with fish or chicken.

Moqueca: A seafood stew made with fish or shrimp, coconut milk, onions, peppers, and spices.

Feijoada: A hearty bean stew made with pork, sausage, and spices.

Grilled Lobster: A popular seafood dish served with garlic butter and lemon.

Xerem: A traditional dish made with cornmeal, beans, vegetables, and spices.

Tuna tartare: A dish made with fresh tuna, avocado, onion, and lemon juice.

Pastéis: Fried pastry pockets filled with fish or meat, often served as a snack or appetizer.

Doce de Papaia: A sweet dessert made with papaya, sugar, and spices.

Café da manhã: A traditional breakfast that typically includes fresh fruit, bread, coffee, and cheese.

Overall, the cuisine of São Tomé and Príncipe is diverse and flavorful, with plenty of options for seafood lovers and vegetarians alike. Be sure to sample some of these dishes during your visit to experience the unique flavors of the country.
